Problem 40. Let r be a fixed positive integer, and let H(r) be the Hamming
ball of radius r in Fn
2. Let f(r) be the smallest constant such that there exists an
infinite sequence of ns together with subspaces Vn ⩽Fn
2 with Vn + H(r) = Fn
2 and
|Vn| = (f(r) + o(1))
2n
|H(r)|. Does f(r) →∞?
Comments. This is a very basic problem about linear covering codes, for which
[67] (particularly Chapter 12) may be consulted.
The only value known is f(1) = 1. This follows from the existence of the Ham-
ming code: let n = 2m −1, and take Vn to be the kernel of the m × (2m −1) matrix
in which the columns are the non-zero vectors in Fm
